website_summaries.verdict: Its many available inputs and access to three 4K/HD displays at once makes this a solid option for anyone with multiple high-end displays.
pros: Includes 3 USB 3.0, 2 USB 2.0, Gigabit Ethernet ports, headphone jack, etc
cons: The ability to connect to multiple 4K displays would have been nice

customer_reviews.title: Extends to two additional monitors via Macbook Air USB
customer_reviews.text: I needed a way to extend my laptop across two additional monitors. I have Thinkpad running Windows 10 and the other, 2012 Macbook Air running 10.1 (El Capitan). I can connect either laptop and they both work. I can run both the laptop and two additional monitors as extensions (3 independent screens total). For the Mac I did need to download the driver from the Dell site, which was simple. Really pleased this device works for both operating systems. Quality is just fine for my business related programs; I can't comment on running graphic intensive programs.
customer_reviews.author: Crissy Field

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for Mac's, but can be used.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could just review w/o rating. I tested this w/ a Macbook Pro early 2016. It works, however, there are some caveats. 1. You need to download drivers from displaylink.com for Mac. 2. Latency on the monitor connected to this is 'ok' but can be excruciating when doing something simple like pulling up a folder from the dock. It becomes painfully obvious that it's an issue. My experience was based on Early 2016 Macbook Pro and Dell U3415W (Sub-4K monitor) I really wanted this to work, but the USB 3.0 seemed to be severely lacking in speed for display. I am rather curious if Dell systems have the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Zsoldier

customer_reviews.title: To make matters worse Dell technical would not talk to me unless I ...
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn't even deserve 1 star. The docking station is supposed to be compatible with my Dell Inspirion 17 but was not. After installing the drivers it corrupted my bios requiring me to reinstall Windows 10 and losing all of my data and apps. To make matters worse Dell technical would not talk to me unless I paid them $129 for upper level tech support. I paid them thinking they would provide me with a solution that would save my data and apps but to no avail. I could have achieved the same result on my own. The major issue is that this product can really screw up your computer and system. Buyer Beware.
customer_reviews.author: satoshi kojima

customer_reviews.title: Very nice dock if you do not plan to use it on Linux
customer_reviews.text: This dock was very simple to set up and works well. However, the DisplayLink driver software on Ubuntu Linux chews up 80%+ CPU and makes even a very powerful computer useless. This is a known issue and has been open with DisplayLink since 2017. Since they show no inclination to fix the problem I will need to replace this with a dock which does not use the DL software. Update: I replaced this item with a Dell WD19TB Thunderbolt Docking Station and my system has been rock solid since. The Thunderbolt cable is short on the WD19TB but extending it will cause charging to fail.
customer_reviews.author: Traveller

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I may want a 3rd monitor, in the near future. But for now, it was easy to just plug everything in and have it up and running in 5mins. Love my new home set up for working remotely on winter days :)
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this Dell USB docking station because I only had one HDMI port on my Dell Inspiron 17" 5759 laptop. I needed it to connect the third Spectre 27" monitor. I checked the Dell site and with the techs here at work. They reported NO problems with this Dell docking station and they were right. I had both the laptop and docking station up and running in less than an hour. NO problems. That includes unpacking both the monitor and docking station, installing them, and downloading the Dell software. Boom! No need to spend the extra bucks on the Dell site and that Spectre monitor looks beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Sandford

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and the answer to my problem
customer_reviews.text: It seems simple enough, you want to have multiple monitors hooked up to your computer. I tried MANY different options and nothing seemed to be compatible with my computer (which is less than 6 months old). Most need a "Thunderbolt 3" connection with USB C - something my computer did not come with, and also not cheap to add. I was extremely frustrated, and finally tried this hub. It was extremely easy to install, and it worked. Plus it has a connection for my speakers, keyboard, mouse, etc. When I need to switch from my work laptop to my home computer, I only have to unplug 1 cable. Absolutely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great dock station up to three different monitors...
customer_reviews.text: I have a metallic stand with 3 monitors. I can connect my monitors without issue, it just require a quick software installation and configuration. My monitors are 2 HDMI and one DisplayPort. They work great without issues. Also this dock station counts with LAN RJ-45 port, 2 USB 3.0, 2 USB for charge, one audio jack for microphone and headset and one output audio jack. Resolution of video is up to 4K. I'm very satisfied with the results.
customer_reviews.author: eightpassenger

customer_reviews.title: Work from home no brainer
customer_reviews.text: I needed to get a home setup for my remote work, and needed to have duel monitors as I do a lot of work with excel spreadsheets. This was a breeze to setup, just plug it in and it’s good to go. This might be because my computer already had the drivers (we use dell hubs at work). Over all it works great and I’ve had no issues with performance. It is worth noting that this does not charge your laptop when plugged in, the front USB ports charge (but very very slowly). Overall this meats my needs and for the cost comparison of the newer models it’s worth the savings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for expanding
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little product. I bought it used, and aside from needing a Swiss Army knife to get into the package, it was great. Longest part of installation was getting IT to log in and install the drivers, which actually took about 2 minutes. This is -literally- plug and play. I already had 2 monitors connected via display cords to my work at home desktop. I add this baby to a USB slot, and suddenly, I can have up to 5 monitors. I only was expanding to 3, but now I have options... My wallet greatly dislikes this plan 😂
customer_reviews.author: M. Mertz

customer_reviews.title: Works on MacOS too!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a soultions to use three monitors on my MacBook Pro for a while now and I haven't even considered this. I ordered it for the dell e7350 and it works as described. I was pleasantly surprised however at the fact that all I needed to do was grab mac drivers from the display link website to make this work! Such a happy camper right now.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin S

customer_reviews.title: Reliable dock for USB 3.0 PCs without USB-C
customer_reviews.text: I like to use these in combination with their D6000 USB-C dock when supporting very large monitors that accept up to four video inputs. The combination supports two of those feeds via DP-over-USB-C (hardware video) and two more via DisplayLink (software video) and D3100 video ports. Performance is acceptable for business use (but would be totally inappropriate for gaming or video streaming/playback where latency would be problematic). These are solid units that I'm not concerned about leaving in production for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Accounting IT

customer_reviews.title: I don't know if this counts as a docking station
customer_reviews.text: The problem with this "docking station" is that one of the key features of a docking station is to power your laptop. This product does not do this. It's basically a tool to add more screens to your device as well as an ethernet connection--but you still have to plug in your power cable to your laptop directly unless you want it to die. I am going to return this and get a docking station that will actually charge my laptop as well. The product itself is fine, but the title is extremely misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Damien

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% plug and play but as close as you can get
customer_reviews.text: The only pre-requisite I had to complete was to download and install a display link driver to support the dock. I would suggest doing this BEFORE buying the dock as the driver goes through a compatibility check before installing and should give you a better idea of whether or not the dock is compatible with your system. This item is perfect for what I am using it for, primary work/home computer, for which I need up to 3 displays including the laptop screen. I am not a gamer so I don't need raw video power but this was an excellent $140 solution for me. I will add updates as I continue to use/experiment with the dock.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Leser

customer_reviews.title: Cant Believe How Easy This Was
customer_reviews.text: First off I followed the instructions before plugging anything in and made sure the DisplayLink drivers where installed. Than plugged power and usb 3.0 into my computer . The DisplayPort took about 15 seconds to recognize but the hdmi took less then 2 seconds. In addition to this I have my laptop screen and then another output going to my tv making 5 monitors . If I had a six it would work as well but don’t need that for what I’m doing.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Haak

customer_reviews.title: We have a bunch of these and every single one has the monitor flicker to some degree some are terrible some are a little better
customer_reviews.text: OMG monitor flickering. Dell can't figure it out worked with Dell support almost a year. We have a bunch of these and every single one has the monitor flicker to some degree some are terrible some are a little better. Bought thisand no more flicker. Dell dock with a Dell laptop you would figure they would be fine. But that isn't the case. Wouldn't recommend find something else.
customer_reviews.author: TheDroidYou'reLookingFor

customer_reviews.title: Not plug and play.. no power
customer_reviews.text: Not what expected.. it just a docking station without option to power your laptop. So I need to plug my power cord all the time to my computer. I hate it is not plug n’ play. I have it for working from home and I need to install the drivers and I do not have an admin password; so I need to go to my company’s IT and give an explanation of why I am installing personal devices..and everytime there is an update in my laptop the drivers are gone. And painful process again..
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Video is great. USB not so much.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it would handle multiple HDMI outputs at impressive resolutions. In this the product is solid. My keyboard and mouse are connected to the back USB ports. This is where the problem is. Both peripherals appear to connect and disconnect multiple times per minute. I have the current software drivers for everything. This makes gaming difficult and typing anything an exercise is frustration as I frequently have to disconnect and reconnect the keyboard. My advice would be to buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bielski

customer_reviews.title: No it doesn't charge your laptop
customer_reviews.text: Even the Dell Support line promised that a current model Dell laptop would be charged up using this Dell Docking Station. WRONG! This sucker was supposed to use the super USB 3.0 and Display Port to keep the laptop fully charged while you work on up to THREE monitors. It drained my charged laptop in less than three hours. I bought one from Amazon two weeks ago, and paid $169 for it. Today January 8, it's selling on Amazon for $105. It's not even worth that. I guess even Dell drank the Kool-Aid.
customer_reviews.author: Rice Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Works with PC and Apple
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and in perfect condition. Using this to connect two monitors, speakers, and wireless keyboard/mouse for both my Work laptop (Dell Latitude e7440 with Win 10) and my personal Macbook Pro (running Mojave with USB-C to USB converter)
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Only good for <3 months...very sad :(
customer_reviews.text: I received the docking station on December 3rd and it was very easy to set up. On December 4th it was up and running and working like a dream. It handled 2 and 3 displays seamlessly. And just a few days shy of 3 months it just stopped working, no displays on either monitor, nothing...just black screens. :( This is very sad, it was working so well when it worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Phire B. Sapphire

customer_reviews.title: Surprised they still sell this piece of garbage
customer_reviews.text: There have been many complaints about the DisplayLink and peripheral USB setup. Followed the steps on the Dell Support page and I'm still getting the same problems. I thought it was my issue at first but it's been buggy for half a year now. I randomly lose connection to my wireless headset, wired mouse and keyboard will freeze, and my monitor will flicker and disconnect randomly. Also tried gaming through HDMI and received about 20-30fps when I can get 160fps+ connected directly to my laptop. This dock has been nothing but an inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Not 4K on all three displays.
customer_reviews.text: This device is supposed to be able to display one three screens. Did not have any issues getting that done. But you don’t get full resolutions on every screen. You can only get 1080p on two screens, and the third one renders at a lower resolution of 768p. I tried numerous times to correct the issue but ultimately learned it was due to the device capability. Upgrade to something better if you want full resolution display for three screens.
customer_reviews.author: Peppa Unboxing

customer_reviews.title: worked as expected for 16 months then died.
customer_reviews.text: This product works for me as expected, until it reached 16 months (1/1/2020 exactly, in fact) then would not drive the HDMI displays, which was ultimately what I bought it to do, so it was then useless. I do not think that that is very good performance for a Dell product or for a three digit expense. Readers should be clear that this device is really a port replicator or multiplier. It does not charge your computer or dock in the mechanical connection sense. It attaches to your computer via USB.
customer_reviews.author: David Holoman

customer_reviews.title: Definitely disappointing and there are reviews on Amazon and off that talk about it
customer_reviews.text: I love Dell products and buying accessories made by the manufacturer for their laptops, but this product was a big big letdown, first reading through some of the spec and compatibility stuff can be confusing, but the big nail in the coffin on this product was the fact that it did not do proper HDMI support and you had to fiddle excessively with going to a third party for driver. I would totally expect to try next time an amazon basics replicator
customer_reviews.author: mike000mike

customer_reviews.title: Small and powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I use it when I work from home. I use a Dell Latitude E5570 with three Acer monitors (two 27in and one 24in). Without the docking station, the laptop has trouble with just the two 27in monitors. With the docking station I have enough additional power to use all three and if I choose the monitor from the laptop itself (I generally keep the shell closed on the laptop and just use the three monitors). I think this is a great product to help boost your laptop and give you more screen real estate.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great tool but get the right drivers
customer_reviews.text: This can be a great tool and although I did not get the CD- which, would have been much easier- I did contact the seller and they immediately sent me links to the drivers and a credit for my troubles. Overall, is say get some cord control and make sure you're using the correct drivers and you'll be really happy
customer_reviews.author: Lori Ruff

customer_reviews.title: A great idea but I had some issues.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to compliment my new laptop purchase. However, I found out that this was not very compatible with my new Dell Inspiron 7773 2-in-1 laptop. First, this is not a true docking station since it does not charge the laptop while in use. Second, the video out to a monitor through the HDMI output to a DVI monitor input was worse than the HDMI output direct from the laptop. Lastly, a part was missing and the item looked like it was used. I returned within a week without a hassle. You may have better luck than I did; just check the compatibility first.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hogston

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value - Works Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love the price of this Dock Station. Bought for new Dell, as lowest cost way to hook up multiple screens and have extra USB Ports. Price was amazing, less than 1/3 of what Dell wants for a 2 screen docking station with less features. Could not rate Tech support as too simple to use, even for this 70+ non, tech guy. There is no sleep mode or Camera so nothing else to add, but GREAT VALUE and Great solution! Would buy again!!
customer_reviews.author: TexKan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my displays
customer_reviews.text: I had a laptop and two external monitors to set up. This docking station was perfect. I now have 3 displays and they run seamlessly (after you install the driver) I also have my mouse and keyboard attached via USB, as well as a wired ethernet connection. I haven't run into any issues yet, and it's discrete enough that it doesn't take up a lot of space or look out of place on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: memery

customer_reviews.title: It will do until it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: I'm not impressed with this. I only purchased it to mirror my workspace at home with what's at work. The issue i have is with my monitors going out randomly every blue moon for NO reason. I'm running Win10 on a Dell 7470. At the time when I did the setup, I found out it was a known issue, but it's been over 6mths ago and i can't remember if the docking station or the pc was the culprit. I don't feel like doing the research again.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: every Dell user should have one of these.
customer_reviews.text: works exactly the way I needed it to. A bunch of USB ports, two HDMI connectors, one DP connector and of course an Ethernet port. to use all three monitors, I had to use two adapters. Here is what I used:  (this is the DP to VGA)  (this is the HDMI to VGA) as you can see from the picture, the hub works fantastic! takes only about 20 to 30 seconds to connect up and start working. Oh, and, I'm also using a wireless mouse through the hub with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: EMarco

customer_reviews.title: Meh. It's ok. Limited. Know the limitiations.
customer_reviews.text: The only way to get 4K out of this unit is via a DisplayPort to DisplayPort cable. HDMI will not get you there. Does not charge your laptop. Laptop will need its own power supply. Does not have the latest USB ports; 3.1 3.1 C-whatever. You know the 10 mbps ones, only has the 5 mbps USB ports. Can't say it is worth $100.00. I would spend a little more to get a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: von Mises

customer_reviews.title: Trouble after 2 1/2 years
customer_reviews.text: Amazon tells me I bought this dock 2 1/2 years ago. For the last couple of months I have had to reboot the dock (unplug, plug back in) every morning. I leave the computer on 24/7 for online backup. One reboot doesn't always do the trick. I have not done all the possible tests to rule out a computer issue, rather than a dock issue, but since rebooting just the dock works, the dock is my suspect. I am running two external monitors, and until this recent issue had no problems after a tricky setup.
customer_reviews.author: Duane R-H

customer_reviews.title: Cooler then it looks, This thing drips connectivity.
customer_reviews.text: Great Quality. Great Packaging. Comes in an "appleesq" white box with fancy fittings. Comes with power adapter and usb connector that looks like a 'b' connector but which has two levels (box over box). Download the driver first from DisplayLInk/Downloads. Then power up. I provided the hdmi cables to my two monitors, and the usb2 cable to my printer. Works great except the second monitor was dark. (User error) In display settings (win10) when I selected the third monitor and set the multiple display, resolution, orientation to valid values. The monitor came to life. 60 bucks cheaper then the Dell site.
customer_reviews.author: Rowland Shepard

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Charge Laptop - Not a true docking station but rather a port replicator
customer_reviews.text: It has plenty of ports and allows a lot of versatility for additional monitors. Requires a driver for more than one monitor make sure to download that driver to avoid frustration. Cons: Does not charge laptop, does not work well with any connection except DVI on my machines. Requires two power cords, one to run the replicator and one to charge the battery. There are better replicators for less money on the market. Pros: It works minimally Not recommended
customer_reviews.author: Tabascovich

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Windows and Mac/Slack/Zoom - Fails with Google Meetings
customer_reviews.text: This has worked reliably for several years on Windows. I recently started using it interchangeably with a macbook pro. For the macbook, there were some driver permission issues that once were solved work great extending my desktop. I use screen sharing a lot with COVID with my work and Slack/Zoom works perfectly, but google meet doesn't work at all in sharing screens.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Good product misleading condition
customer_reviews.text: The actual product works perfect, however, my disappointment is with how it came. I was under the assumption I was buying a new product, but when the box came it was being held close by a piece of duck tape, all the instructions were crinkled up to fit back in the box, and there was a missing piece (the outlet cord). Luckily the outlet cord for my laptop fit so not a big issue there. Just be aware that even though you are buying something "new" it may be an open box new.
customer_reviews.author: Matt J

customer_reviews.title: It's a Dell Product - Solid
customer_reviews.text: Normally I don't mind buying other name brand products but I stuck with Dell for this purchase. I have used this at the office and had no issues, thought it best to stay with what works for my home set up as I connected a Dell laptop to two Dell screens. Easy to download the required software - after that it was just plug and play. The additional USB ports are a big help as we connected an external HD, and a mouse/keyboard USB hub.
customer_reviews.author: Losfirstduty

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for about a year.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this with a windows laptop and 3 monitors. 2 plugged into hdmi and 1 with displayport. The one using the dp has always giving me trouble(turns off and on randomly once in a while). Other than that it worked great but it is now giving me trouble at the one year mark. It will drop video feeds and I have to constantly refresh the browser to continue.
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Made Life Easier...
customer_reviews.text: This display station made things much easier for us when editing our videos for YouTube. Multiple screens are a necessary when you are switching back and forth between viewing and editing videos. We highly recommend this product for its ease of use and the convenience it provides is priceless. This product have allowed us to produce the videos for our channel such the one at this link:  Thank you from Swamp Shangrila - Rural Living!
customer_reviews.author: Selective Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Docking station!
customer_reviews.text: Any amount of praise will fall short for this nice little docking station (D3100). It works with my Dell XPS, it works with my office HP elitebook laptop. It also works with my late 2013 macbook pro. You just have to download the right drivers from dell's website. It is just fantastic. I love this docking station and have recommended this to everybody. I don't see why dell cannot call this a universal docking station. Very very happy with this purchase! Monitor picture quality, sound, external hdds, network, everything works perfectly. I couldn't ask for more. I am not a gamer so cannot review that.
customer_reviews.author: kapilmath

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Easiest setup I've ever seen with a piece of technology. Just download the drivers from the website listed on a card directly in view as you open the box. Once you do that just hook everything up and you're good to go. I often use a corded mouse (because gaming) and some external speakers and occasionally a monitor attached to my laptop. All of this works flawlessly and was so easy to use. It's nice to just leave all the peripherals hooked up to this and just have one USB to plug into my computer now instead.
customer_reviews.author: David Hasbun

customer_reviews.title: Great performance with one small flaw
customer_reviews.text: The docking station is nice and small and even portable for some of my uses. The one problem I have and why the star taken away is because the display driver flakes out every so often and creates a black one inch stripe across the bottom of my main monitor just randomly. Seems to mostly effect browsers but also other functions like file explorer and others. Sometimes requires a full restart of my laptop to correct it. Other than that it’s fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Jason T.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great w/ Asus Laptop + HP Monitors
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 2015 Asus laptop. I wanted to use dual monitors at 1080p. Installed the drivers and it works great. You have to mess around with Display settings in Windows 10 in order to use it while the laptop is closed. Works as expected and I haven't had any issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Par1000

customer_reviews.title: Easiest way to add up to 3 monitors to my Laptop!
customer_reviews.text: The setup couldn't be easier. Download the drivers via the included instructions, plug the monitors in to the docking station, use the included USB to connect the laptop to the back of the station, DONE! My current setup is using one HDMI from my laptop and 2 HDMI's from the back of the docking station. Literally took 2 minutes to setup, didn't even need to make any adjustments. Make sure to download the drivers before install, the box comes with the needed url.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: basic docking station
customer_reviews.text: You will have to leave your monitor plugged into your computer to set up the drivers. Once done, you can move the external monitors to the station. Some feature of your camera may not work if plugged into this. For example, the follow me feature of the Logitech Rally cam will not work when plugged into this. Otherwise, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Graham

customer_reviews.title: Slows down internet when used on Mac
customer_reviews.text: It is the strangest thing. When i am using with a macbook over wifi, it slows down the internet to speeds of less than 1 Mbps. When i unplug, it shoots back up to 60+ mbps. I don't understand... I only use this thing to extend my display to 2 external monitors. What the heck does it have to do with my internet?
customer_reviews.author: AudioBuff91

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do exactly what I was told it would do.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to be able to use my external monitors, mouse, and keyboard with the laptop closed. I searched online and chatted with a dell expert and they said this model would do that. So I ordered it and it came in and my monitors do not work when the laptop is closed. I found a workaround which is to use all 3 monitors, however, I didn't give it 5 stars because it didn't do what I was told it could do, otherwise, it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Besaw

customer_reviews.title: As good as my old Dell E-port docking station without taking up my whole desk.
customer_reviews.text: I am connecting it to a Dell Latitude 5550. I am connecting my system to two Asus V279x monitors, and not using the builtin display. I have no problems at all running 1902 x 1080. I did seem some slowness when using a USB 2 extension cable, but that was to be expected. Use a usb 3.0 cable and everything is good. Questions I had: Does the device have a power switch. No I have to power on the PC. Will it work with the lid closed. Yes once I changed the settings under power options to Closed lid does nothing when power connected. All good. Wireless keyboard and mice work great. Also works well with my macbook Pro 2014.
customer_reviews.author: amysun123

customer_reviews.title: Only Use Dell Accessories for Dell Laptops
customer_reviews.text: I had another brand docking station and it gave me lots of problems. I bought a Dell one 4 years ago which performed great. I have 2 printers, my monitor, the cable company internet plug attached and everything worked great. I bought a second laptop and knew I should only buy another Dell.
customer_reviews.author: ITS GREAT

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves this
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for my wife to help her with here genealogical work. She wanted to be able to see three different displays at a time showing different information to help resolve identities and this worked great. She now has two larger HDMI displays plus the one on her laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - Until It's NOT
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new Dell laptop, so wanted to go with Dell as the docking station for monitors and external devices. Big mistake. HUGE. I bought this in April, and in exactly one year and one month, the device has failed - both monitors now blink on and off. My IT guys have eliminated that it's a computer issue, or a monitor issue - and have isolated the issue to the docking station. You have this timed perfectly, Dell - one year and one month puts it out of warranty, so I get to spend $130 all over again. It WILL NOT be on a Dell product (nor will it be Dell when I replace my laptop).
customer_reviews.author: Anita Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Great Docking Station
customer_reviews.text: I use this docking station with 3 HP w2338h monitors, running at 1920x1080 in Slackware64-current without any issues. The setup was straight forward, without any issues. I use the two USB ports in the back to connect devices and the front 3.5 mm connector for a headset. The two HDMI ports and the Display port are being used by the three monitors
customer_reviews.author: F. Bobbio C.

customer_reviews.title: Lag
customer_reviews.text: Was able to connect my laptop (PC) and 2 monitors but my mouse and keyboard lag like crazy. Really wish I could return it but I’m past that window. For how much this thing cost you’d think it would work without issues. I thought it might be the drivers but I have the latest drivers.
customer_reviews.author: amazonuserr

customer_reviews.title: Triple Monitor Set up with EASE...absolutely love it
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea that all accessories/printers/wireless keyboard-mouse dongle etc can be permanently attached to the docking station and connecting/removing the laptop is super easy. I have 3 monitors set up and absolutely loving it. No issues so far after 2 years of purchase. Just wish they had all three display port as HDMI. Currently it is not. I have used HDMI conversion adapters that are available at low cost on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: My 2 Cents

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer Warranty doesn't cover without Serial Number
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Dell Docking Station (D3100) on Amazon, my monitor is freezing because of the Docking station, Dell technical Support needs either Dell Order Number or Servicetag/SerialNumber I gave them the MAC and QR code from the back of this which they say it's not what they are expecting, had called Amazon customer service if they could help and got frustrating response, from my experience I would never these kind of products from Amazon as it would not be covered by manufacturer warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Get the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I have a similar docking station at work, and this has been really nice to use hooked up to 2 external monitors at home. My wife also has an HP work laptop and this has seemed to work with the docking station as well, and has eliminated some of the connection issues she had with her HP dock. The only thing keeping me from giving it a 5th star is that I did not realize this has only the USB 3.0 connection and will therefore not charge my Dell laptop like the one I use at work.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Broken on windows 10
customer_reviews.text: This does not work with the latest update of Windows 10 (as of 10/1/2016). There is no working driver and the Dell web site says they are not developing one. The lack of driver causes random freezing of the mouse pointer and desktop for about a quarter second, once or twice a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Bigham

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This product is such a life saver. It came early and was perfect right out of the box, even connecting to my older laptop. I use it primarily so that I can have 2-3 monitors connected at one time, but the other features on the device make it outstanding. I was worried about the price, but after using it for a month feel that it was well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Among the best productivity hub I've found yet
customer_reviews.text: This hub does everything but 4k @ 60 hz, which is difficult to get at this price point. The standout features: 5 USB 3.0 ports, dual HDMI ports with a single DisplayPort for video; reasonably fast network speed (500 Mbps on Cat5e cables), and utterly beautiful sound. I dinged a single star for the limited network speed and lack of 60 Hz support for 4k monitors.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lippa

customer_reviews.title: It will not work for apple when it clearly states that it will and it offers the drivers
customer_reviews.text: The product worked for 5 weeks and then stopped working. I tried to call product support and they told me that this is a Dell product and it is not compatible with Apple. I asked them if that was true then why do you have to download the drivers from Dell's website. After arguing for a few minutes I realized that it is not worth my time and that they do not care. Overall, this docking system worked great for five weeks but will not last. Do not buy this, just buy the 15in mac book.
customer_reviews.author: Eberst's

customer_reviews.title: Turn your laptop into a powerful triple monitor workstation
customer_reviews.text: We use this to convert my wife's Acer Aspire E 15 E5-575G-76YK into a triple monitor workstation at home. Simply plug monitors, mouse, keyboard, printer, network cable and any other USB devices into the docking station, then plug single USB cable from the station into the laptop's USB 3 port. On the first connection it took some time for Windows 10 to load and install all the proper drivers, but it was all automatic and now this device works perfectly. My wife love's it and I am very impressed with how well it performs!
customer_reviews.author: Geewiz

customer_reviews.title: Great device. Designed with all the needed ports
customer_reviews.text: Much needed for my home office. Allows me to have a hub to use as central plug in for all things and simply unplug my laptop to go mobile. Makes life much easier!!
customer_reviews.author: LisaBailey

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Docking Station !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I use three (3) 27" HD monitors with this docking station. Two have 1900x1200 resolution. I tried many other products, but nothing worked as well as this docking station. I simply plugged it into the USB port and it worked instantly and I am NOT a techie by any means. The thee (3) front USB ports make plugging in external data drives, flash drives, cell phones, and/or smart watches a breeze. I wish I had found and bought this docking station FIRST !!!! I highly recommend this docking station !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stuart A. Moir

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: One of the best docking station's ever. It was incredibly easy to install and still easy to use. Used it for a dual screen setup off of laptop and the 2 HDMI's and multiple USB are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: This works great. Now I'm setup for two full sized monitors not including my laptop.
customer_reviews.text: I only have one HDMI port on my laptop and now I can have two full sized monitors for my home office. Don't know how people can be efficient without multiple monitors. Each one works independently of one another just like I needed it to be.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrod

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Item came with all the ports it was advertised to have. Directions for setup were simple, clear, and correct. And now I only have 1 cable to connect and disconnect when I take my laptop from my desk. External monitors connected are working as expected while connected through this dock.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa R. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product but Heat issues
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent docking station for price but I don't expect such corner case issue with Dell - I am using this docking station for my daily usage for 2, 1080p monitors. It picked up heat after few hours of usage. With only 2 monitor load its not acceptable cause this docking station support 3 monitor with 4k resolution!!
customer_reviews.author: The Patel

customer_reviews.title: I like that it is a universal docking station (since I ...
customer_reviews.text: It took a while but I have now used this in my new office to drive to external monitors from my Surface Pro 4. I like that it is a universal docking station (since I have another Lenovo laptop that I use on occasion) & can use with any new laptop that I might buy. Was concerned that the video of the monitors might have delay but I really haven't seen any yet. Granted, I'm doing Excel spreadsheets, engineering software, & PowerPoint, not video games. You'd have to decide for yourself if you're a gamer if this works OK.
customer_reviews.author: John L. Jechura Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Update to “piece of junk” review
customer_reviews.text: I previously posted a review complaining that the docking station would not function properly with my Logitech wireless track ball and keyboard, that the problem was a known and difficult to fix issue. After many frustrating hours, my tech support finally figured out that the problem was caused by the Logitech USB receivers. I give this only three stars because every time you jostle it, the monitor resets due to loose connections. Still not very satisfied, but the most irritating problem was not Dell’s fault
customer_reviews.author: EPS

customer_reviews.title: I bought this despite the poor scores because it was one of the only USB ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this despite the poor scores because it was one of the only USB hubs I could find with dual hdmi outputs and Dell generally has good products. What a mistake. It randomly stops working at least once a day and it also stops working if I leave my computer for more than an hour it stops working too. This means I have to unplug it an reset the device driver at least once per day.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bojangles

customer_reviews.title: Uses CPU power to run the extended displays, so ...
customer_reviews.text: Uses CPU power to run the extended displays, so make sure your CPU is at least a twin core and check your power settings if you have any troubles. After connecting this up to my first quadcore laptop, I noticed the frame rate was sluggish on the extended monitors. Then I plugged the power cable into the laptop and my power settings went to full on everything and the displays were not sluggish anymore. I have two 23" monitors connected to it running 2560x1080 without a hitch. Though it's not a true dock and just a port replicator, the performance is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: dave haaland

customer_reviews.title: It works with an ASUS LAPTOP (FX53V)
customer_reviews.text: I have my ASUS laptop connected to this Dell Triple Display Docking Station which I taught was not compatible with my PC. I have it connected to three monitors (Two HDMI and one DisplayPort). Everything works fine expect for me. Only issue I is that the display settings need to be (sometimes) set again when you close or you put the laptop to sleep. But I will still buy it.
customer_reviews.author: tselmen

customer_reviews.title: Cuts the normal output of desktop speakers in HALF.
customer_reviews.text: If I plug my desktop speakers directly into my laptop, it is uncomfortable to my ears at full volume. If I plug my desktop speakers into this docking station, the top volume is HALF the output. I am not a moron and I do not have a some setting or connection wrong. So, if I use the docking station for my mouse, keyboard, and monitor, but still have to plug into my laptop for my speakers, that kind of defeats the purpose of the convenience (and cord management) of a docking station.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy T.

customer_reviews.title: Used but works great.
customer_reviews.text: I got mine cheaper due to damage. It works good for now but when you move it or shake it you can hear a screw or sodder moving around inside I sure hope it keeps working. I'm loving it for now tho. Only got 2 monitors hooked up for the time being.
customer_reviews.author: April Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Easy Hookup
customer_reviews.text: Had two 32" monitors hooked up in minutes. Works great. One item I wish it did was to also charge my laptop battery. Need separate power cord for laptop (not a big deal). No issues at all after several months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky Dawg

customer_reviews.title: Great video quality and performance
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it. Using it with a Dell 7558 laptop and 2 external monitors. Well worth the money. Great increase in productivity using 3 total screens and all the extra USB ports available are handy. Now I can dock with just a USB and power cable and be connected to wired gigabit internet.
customer_reviews.author: nys464

customer_reviews.title: this looked like a viable option
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Dell D3100 dock because I wanted to use 2 monitors with a MacBook Air. Since the MBA only has 1 Thunderbolt port and I was unable to find a decent USB to HDMI adapter, this looked like a viable option. I also relied an the comments that another purchaser had used this for an MBA. The key is to download the Mac OS X drivers from the DisplayLink website [...] The disk Dell provides has Windows drivers only. Once the drivers were installed it was plug and play. Granted the dock is fairly expensive but it was the only one I could find with 2 HDMI ports.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: pros and cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros Very reliable and fast Cons It does not have auto driver detection by Windows 10
customer_reviews.author: Arman Dabiri

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Got this so that I can easily attach my HP Envy 15 laptop, HP M7 laptop or Lenovo Yoga 900 to my three HP 2009m monitors, Wacom tablet and various hard drives and peripherals on the fly. Now four active, fast and beautiful monitors are a single USB cord away! Works perfectly and has really streamlined my desk while increasing my productivity. This replaced a Toshiba DynaDock that finally bit the dust. That was handy, but this is ten times better. Higher quality output (HD via DP or HDMI) faster, lower profile, better looking and more capable. Very happy with this purchase. If I get my office cleaned up, I'll post some photos of the setup.
customer_reviews.author: Just S

customer_reviews.title: This is everything that is designed to be
customer_reviews.text: Why you need more than 1 or two monitors in a pinch, this sub $100 price on the Dell Display Port Docking station is a must have! I use one for work and run 5 monitors off of it and at home with 3 monitors off my laptop. The resolution is on point and no lagging issues when gaming that I noticed! If you need more monitors get this, doesn't matter if you have a dell or an HP this will work for you!
customer_reviews.author: Frank H

customer_reviews.title: Good product, after first faulty unit
customer_reviews.text: The first product I purchased had a faulty HDMI port. I talked to Amazon customer service and got a replacement unit. It works well for my needs. I have a Surface Pro 3 and enjoy using multiple desktops. It took a bit to find the right drivers on Dell's website and set everything up. I'm running two 1920x1200 Dell monitors (one via HDMI, one via DP, both converted to DVI), a wired keyboard, and a wireless mouse. I've been having trouble with the Ethernet cable and am still not sure if it's a hardware or driver issue.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G

customer_reviews.title: Ordered two of these and same problems on both. ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of these and same problems on both. The screen freezes and will not refresh until you adjust the window size or close and reopen the program. This happens most often while using the internet browser. If you switch between tabs it will still show some of the first tab's webpage on the second until you resize the window or move something else on the screen. It's doesn't always occur and unplugging it and plugging it back in seems to fix the problem for a couple hours. It's just a pain to use. Clearly these needs an update to get the bugs out.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: 4 monitors!
customer_reviews.text: I have two monitors connected by display adapter, one by HDMI, plus my laptop, coax cable, portfolio drive, all working together. Only negative, the USB ports are not powerful enough to keep my phone charged
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Generally a solid docking station . . .
customer_reviews.text: Does what it claims to, but requires a lot of software downloads and updates to get you there. Additionally, the DisplayPort had additional issues, so I ended up running everything through the HDMI ports. Overall, a solid docking station for the price, but not plug-and-play.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but had some setup trouble.
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Arrived on time. I did find that I was having problems with the dock at first. I got around the problems by updating my video drivers and usb drivers, and by making sure that I do not plug or unplug both the dock and my laptop power supply at the same time. Plugging in the power, waiting 10 seconds, and then plugging in the dock; or unplugging the dock, waiting 10 seconds, and then unplugging the power - this seems to keep my computer from freezing or crashing when using the dock. My setup is 2 1080P monitors with built in USB plugged into the dock, with usb mouse and keyboard, and a webcam.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Literally the worst. I’ve gone through at least 4 returned and new thinking could’ve had faulty hardware. Nope they’re the just terrible docks. Dell should recall every single one. The network drops, graphics driver doesn’t work properly and causes screen blips, and sometimes just freezes altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few docking stations in the past, and they all generally "work". My last one had issues with certain connection types being used on certain monitors, and could be finicky from time to time. This dock had none of those issues. All connections and instructions were straightforward, and it worked right out of the box for my three (one 4k, two HD) monitors, Webcam, wireless mouse, wireless keyboard, and headset. High quality docks for multi-monitor support can tend to get pricy - this one works great for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Blackmer

customer_reviews.title: No issues at all.
customer_reviews.text: Works just as well as the much higher priced Lenovo unit I have in my other office. No problems whatsoever with a dual monitor setup, I haven’t tried three. A great buy being that it is a brand name with a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: DiamondW

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: This is an accessory to my Dell Inspiron Laptop and Dual Dell LCD peripheral monitors. I got tired of reconnecting my 3 screens and getting them all display properly. This works perfectly and is a huge time saver for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: This docking station works exactly as described. I was able to drive (3) 24" external monitors while leaving the laptop display open and using the keyboard and touch pad. I purchased this for my wife because she's in school and she loves it!! Thanks Dell and Amazon!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. A. S.

customer_reviews.title: terrible product
customer_reviews.text: Terrible Docking station causes your laptop to drill out the battery during hibernation mode even when laptop is connected to the electricity causing network issue on the laptop returning this one do not buy this
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works well with modern and old laptops
customer_reviews.text: In few words: I loved it! It works very well even with my old Laptop Inspiron 14 3000 Series Core i3, it only has 1 USB3 port and now it has become a personal station. I have been tested with my 3 old 20" LEDs and LCDs, and I am just testing it with my 2 4K screens, as for now it has no issues. I had to use the Display Link driver instead of the Dell driver because the one in the Dell site is so outdated
customer_reviews.author: Luis M Bernabe M

customer_reviews.title: This Docking Station is Trash
customer_reviews.text: The lag on both of my monitors is terrible. Not to mention that this is falsely listed as a "4k Triple monitor" docking station even though you can only do 4k through the single DP port on the dock. This is a bad docking station and feels cheap. I have been using a 6+ old dell docking station that I thought was ancient and bad until I got this one. You'll notice the lag with your mouse and other applications you run instantly. Not sure how this has such high reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Kalinoski

customer_reviews.title: USB 3 hubs not ready for prime time
customer_reviews.text: While USB 3 hubs are much better than USB 2 hubs, there are still huge issues with lag and reliability. If you are simply hooking up one monitor, a keyboard and mouse you might be fine. But using two monitors with a keyboard, mouse, external hard drive and optical drive is another story. Any time you transfer data via the hard drive things slow down and stutter. Also, watching HD movies on one monitor can severely slow things down and cause stuttering. For now I suggest buying a laptop with a docking connector, waiting for thunderbolt connectors or WiDi to become more popular.
customer_reviews.author: JSS

customer_reviews.title: Good Dock for Laptop
customer_reviews.text: This works well as a "docking station" and would work with almost any laptop because it is not actually a dock. It has a USB cable that connects your laptop to the hub. I did have to buy a USB hub because 2 USB ports just is not enough for if you have mouse, keyboard, printer, scanner. Not a big issue though. I have it setup to where my grandfather only plugs in 1 cable to his laptop and he has access to all of his external items. Makes it very easy for him to use and understand.
customer_reviews.author: RN

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in April 2015. At the time, I was transitioning from two computers - a laptop and a desktop - to one laptop for everyday/ all day use. I have been using this dock in conjunction with my Dell laptop since. The dock made the transition much easier, as I still use my desktop monitor and keyboard just as before. The dock had worked seamlessly since purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Still Working!
customer_reviews.text: Still working. Bought over a year ago. Doesn't always work with the USB wireless mouse/keyboard I have, but for that I just plug into my pc directly. Headphone jack works, doesn't reduce quality much. been a tad rough on it with several office moves, but it's still ticking. Would buy again, even though I'm not a Dell fan at all.
customer_reviews.author: NCH

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly easy
customer_reviews.text: I’m an idiot when it comes to this stuff. I can connect cables and pray, which seemed to work here! I don’t know if the power ports help, I have no idea if the quality is up to par for advanced folks, but for a guy that wants to plug his laptop in and have multiple monitors so he can work from home, it works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Eric T

product_meta.title: Dell USB 3.0 Ultra HD/4K Triple Display Docking Station (D3100), Black
product_meta.description: Full HD displays. The Dell Docking Station allows you to spread out your desktop on up to three external displays, increasing productivity and making it easier to manage multiple applications. Compatible with Latitude 3330, Latitude E6540, Latitude E6440, Precision M3800, Latitude 3340, Inspiron 15 5000 series (5547), Inspiron 14 5000 series (5447), Inspiron 15 3000 series (3542), Inspiron 17 5000 series (5748), Inspiron 15 3000 series (3541), Inspiron 14 3000 series (3442), Inspiron 15R (5545), Inspiron 13 (7347), Inspiron 15 5000 series (5542), Latitude E5250, Latitude E5450, Latitude E5550, Inspiron 15 7000 series (7547), Latitude 14 rugged 5404, Latitude 7350, Inspiron 14 3000 series (3443), Inspiron 15 3000 series (3543), Latitude 3450, Latitude E7250, Latitude E7450, Latitude 3550, XPS 13 (9343), Inspiron 14 3000 series (3451), Inspiron 17 5000 series (5749), Inspiron 15 5000 series (5548), Inspiron 7348, Inspiron 17 7000 series (7548), Inspiron 15 3000 series (3551), Latitude 3150, Inspiron 15 3000 series (3558), Inspiron 14 3000 series (3458), Inspiron 14 5000 series (5458), Inspiron 5558, Inspiron 5551, Vostro 3558, Vostro 14 (3458), Inspiron 7558, Inspiron 5755, Inspiron 5758, Inspiron 5555, Latitude 3160, Inspiron 3552, Inspiron 14 3000 series (3452), Inspiron 15 5000 series (5552), Latitude 3570, Inspiron 14 5000 series (5459), Inspiron 15 5000 series (5559), Inspiron 17 5000 series (5759), Inspiron 11 3000 series (3153), Inspiron 13 7000 series (7353), Inspiron 13 7000 series (7359), Inspiron 15 7000 series (7568), Inspiron 11 3000 series (3158), Inspiron 7559, Vostro 3459, Vostro 3559, XPS 13 (9350), XPS 15 (9550), XPS 12 (9250), Latitude E5470, Latitude E5570, Latitude E7270, Latitude E5270, Inspiron 15 3000 series (3559), Latitude 3470, Latitude 7275, Latitude E7470, Inspiron 15 5000 series (5568), Inspiron 13,7000 series (7368), Inspiron 15 7000 series (7569), Inspiron 17 7000 series (7778), Vostro 3549, Vostro 3449. Inspiron 14 (1440) , Inspiron 14 (1464) , Inspiron 14 (3437) Inspiron 14 (N4050), Inspiron 14 3000 series (3421), Inspiron 14 7000 Series (7437) Inspiron 15 (1525), Inspiron 15 (1526), Inspiron 15 (1545) Inspiron 15 (1564) , Inspiron 15 (3520), Inspiron 15 (3521) Inspiron 15 (3537) , Inspiron 15 5000 series (5565), Inspiron 15 5000 series (5567), Inspiron 15 7000 series (7537) Inspiron 17 (1750) Inspiron 17 (1764), Inspiron 17 (3721), Inspiron 17 (3737), Inspiron 17 5000 series (5767), Inspiron 17 7000 series (7737), Inspiron 17 7000 series (7746), Latitude 12 rugged extreme 7214, Latitude 14 rugged extreme 7414, Latitude 3379 Venue 11 Pro (7140).
feature_bullets: 2 x USB 2.0 to 4 pin USB Type A, 1 x headphone input and output 3.5 millimetre
3 x superspeed USB 3.0 - 9 pin USB type A, 1 x network - RJ-45. Designed for Inspiron 15 7567 Gaming, 5459; Latitude 13 7350, 3350, E5270, E5460, E5470, E5570, E7270, E7470; XPS 13 (9343)
1 x display / video: DisplayPort output : 20 pin DisplayPort, super speed cable
Allow for a triple monitor setup, see compatible Dell models in the description
2 x display / video: HDMI: 19 pin HDMI type A, 1x HDMI DVI adapter included

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,234 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
